summary: One option for buying health insurance plans in the U.S. is through marketplaces. The Affordable Care Act provided a tax credit in some cases to help individuals buy these plans. The U.S. government may pay this credit to insurance issuers in advance, which lowers the individual's monthly bill. We reviewed methods 5 states and the U.S. government used to keep ineligible people from using the...
title: Payment Integrity: Additional Coordination Is Needed for Assessing Risks in the Improper Payment Estimation Process for Advance Premium Tax Credits
